title: Discovered an OP build on Diana
body:
So I was queued into a game yesterday when my internet did an oopsie, meaning I had gotten into a game with the wrong runes on Diana.

Fleet of footwork, Triumph, extra attack speed and coup de grace. Secondary tree was irrelevant.

I went for TP and just hard push waves 'till I get 1100 to get a catalyst and TP back into lane.

And it's OP. Really, really, really OP. Fleet of footwork, along with her shield + taste of blood gives her insane regen and resistance in laning phase. Rod of Ages as a first item coupled with triumph makes you really strong in skirmishes or 1v2s... Nashor's Tooth second item and you're blowing so many auto attacks that Fleet of footwork activates even more often. + the movement speed from fleet of footwork means you can dodge skillshots + stick to your enemies to do even more autos. It's basically bruiser Diana. You're doing more DPS damage, and your resistance is strong enough to catch all your opponents off guard. + you have insane lane pressure because you can push like crazy while also regenerating HP, meaning you can be an insane bully.

I highly recommend all Diana mains to give it a try. It's literally freelo.

replies.body: Coming soon to YouTube: "NEW DIANA OFF-META BUILD! IS THIS 110% BROKEN OP?"

I saw some Diana players using Phase rush for Movement Speed, and it is pretty nice since it easily procs from small combos like R-W-Q. But yeah, your build is great at splitpushing and Dueling. The only problem is that Rod of Ages is a slow, scaling item that significantly delays your Mid Game powerspike.

> [{quoted}](name=Anu3isII,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AEzAFp93,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-18T23:33:27.058+0000)
>
> I saw some Diana players using Phase rush for Movement Speed, and it is pretty nice since it easily procs from small combos like R-W-Q. But yeah, your build is great at splitpushing and Dueling. The only problem is that Rod of Ages is a slow, scaling item that significantly delays your Mid Game powerspike.

I mean, she also lacks decent trading (if the target survives her burst, they win) because she's been made an assassin for no reason. They need to mini-rework her and do more with Moonlight and swap E and R (with a lot of other things being done). Bring the poor lass back to her true design: The first AP Fighter.

> I mean, she also lacks decent trading (if the target survives her burst, they win)

This is probably the reason why health regen on her seems to be working out. The only problem afterwards is that we're losing Electrocute + ap items and getting mana to go along with the health sustain. That works, I'm not gonna lie, but I'll have to keep seeing what fleet of footwork has to offer by trying out different builds.
You're right. We'll see what RoA becomes after next patch, but I'll probably switch away RoA for now.
